These creatures can be encountered anywhere in the royal apartments, and relish in transforming the regal appointments into a place of gory grandeur. They have no desire to leave Castle Drakken. Instead, they want to gain control of the dimensional rift to summon more demons. They believe they can accomplish this by stealing mortal souls and drawing power from holy relics. They tell the following demonic lies:

  • “We were summoned here by the will of the throne, and are bound to keep the castle. Only one who sits upon the throne may discharge us from our servitude.”
  • “Ulrich IV lives. His mind is bound to the disfigured flesh before the throne, and his will alone contains the Haze. If you destroy him, it will consume the world.”
  • “The meteor was in fact a diabolical vessel that crashed here. The devils arrived in Drakkenheim from a portal to Hell in the Crater.”
  • “The Rat Prince is Leonard von Kessel.”

Demonic Sacrifice

“The king is not strong enough to defeat the Haze on his own. However, we will show you how to help him, but it requires you sacrifice your mortal life... and give up the Relics of Saint Vitruvio.”

The demons use the guise of civility to lure characters into a trap where they can use them as a living sacrifice or steal one of the Relics of Saint Vitruvio from them. Though they explain the rite will break the power of the @UUID[Actor.FaQBcQeboMfO6hOL], it's a total lie. Instead, the demons gleefully murder any characters who submit to them and use the relic in their profane summoning rites.

“Always wanted to see the inside of Castle Drakkenwhen I was young. Now not so much.”

— Sebastian Crowe

Throne Room.name: 王座室
Throne Room.text:
This sovereign chamber has a grandiose vaulted ceiling sixty feet overhead and is ringed by magnificent columns supporting a stately balcony halfway up the height of the room. Throughout are countless detailed architectural ornamentations of gold inlaid with emeralds that accent Intricate painted murals depicting regal scenes of glorious conquest. Fleshy tendrils entwine the pillars, twitching membranes stretch across the room, and massive delerium crystals burst through the marble tiled floor. The tall arched windows that lined the walls and galleries have burst inward; whatever intricate designs they once bore shattered amongst pieces of sharp glass floating in the air around each. Instead, the openings look out upon bizarre vistas.

  • The throne room is accessed via the royal antechamber. The rooftop attic rises twenty feet above that outside, and from outside the building, the windows appear intact and opaque.
  • Stumbling around the balcony are 14 ([[/r 4d6]]) @UUID[Actor.WRMeQqdgYSpAR9zx]{Delerium Dregs} in shredded courtier's outfits.

Castle Drakken

The Throne of Drakkenheim

Upon a three-tiered marble platform surrounded by a balustrade and flanked by warped statues of mighty knights is the Throne of Drakkenheim. This imperial throne is fixed into the structure of Castle Drakken, and fashioned from granite and embellished with wrought-iron, marble, and golden filigree. Its broad claw-shaped armrests are embedded with gemstones. The cushions are upholstered in rich hues of deep green. A colossal dragon skull adorns the top of the chair, and skeletal wings rise up from the throne. These once framed a breathtaking circular rose window decorated with prismatic tracery, but instead forms a turbulent eldritch portal beyond which lies an unfathomable landscape.

  • Above the throne is the dimensional rift, which leads to the Space Between Worlds. This churning chaos is the source of all magic and metaphysically connected to every other dimension, plane, and reality. Characters may enter the Space Between Worlds through this portal, but are struck by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.hYCrN82dMJFuJODB] (DC 20) in the process. Those who fail this save are driven mad. See the “Developments” section for details on what lies beyond.
  • The throne is a magical artefact in its own right and indestructible while the castle stands.
  • While seated on the throne, a character attuned to the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.CroT000000000022] may use an action to cast the following spells:

At-will — @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.arzCrMRgcNiQuh43] (DC 20)

1/day each — @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WmQpxfjZwF3MGUby], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.bllEWfm9xfEKynhv] (self only), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ReMbjfeOKoSj3O79] (self only)

3/day — @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.GtGjNjPBgUHxGYAD]

  • The Throne of Drakkenheim is irreversibly contaminated whilst the Haze remains. A humanoid creature seated on the throne can't regain hit points, and each time a creature activates its powers, they must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or take [[/damage 3d6 necrotic average]] damage and gain one level of Contamination.

The Amalgamation

Before the throne is a gibbering amalgamation of fleshy tumors, rotting bones, and rancid layers of bloated fat suspended between the ceiling and floor by stalky strands of gnarled tissue. The mass is covered in bursting sores, shuddering mucus nodules, and weeps bile and delerium sludge, The creature mutters in alien tongues from six yawning mouths, piping and sputtering in discordant musical tones, and lazily shifting eyes of massive size open and close throughout its bulk. Thick trunk-like tentacles reach out from its hideous stinking form to squirm and writhe around the chamber. Several appendages are wrapped around pulsing human organs: lungs, liver, kidney, a heart, a brain, and dangling amongst them is the jewelled @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.CroT000000000022]. A palpable aura of contamination emanates from the beast.

  • The @UUID[Actor.FaQBcQeboMfO6hOL] and [[/r 2d6]] @UUID[Actor.gwrdsxHSdMxcmK79]{Gibbering Mouthers} are here, and slavishly attack any who enter the throne room.
  • While the physical remains of Ulrich IV have become part of the @UUID[Actor.FaQBcQeboMfO6hOL], his mind and soul are forever annihilated.
  • If the @UUID[Actor.FaQBcQeboMfO6hOL] is destroyed, it returns with all its hit points after [[/r 1d10]] days unless the dimensional rift is closed.

“Even my fondest childhood memories of Castle Drakken can't shake the feeling of dread when the shadow looms heavy over the haze.”

— Veo Sjena

Dungeons of Drakkenheim.name: 德拉肯海姆地城
Dungeons of Drakkenheim.text:
The dungeon vaults are accessed through the Stair Tower. Instead of the gilded finery and impressive paintings of the upper chambers, the dungeons are decorated with solemn statuary, mosaic brickwork, detailed bas-relief carvings, and ribbed and vaulted ceilings twenty feet overhead.

Pool of Tears. The base of the Stair Tower houses a glimmering marble fountain. Three mischievous @UUID[Actor.pIco9QnC61hFiUtp]{Gargoyles} are bound to the fountain, nicknamed Cheeky, Rump, and Bazoo. They are friendly to passersby and speak common if addressed. They don't know much about what's happened in the castle, but many years ago they saw the steward run down into the dungeons. He never returned.

Escape Chute Base. This dusty chimney is the base for the escape chimneys in the Royal Apartments. The sliding pole ends about four feet from the ground.

Heroes' Hall. The statues lining this hallway honor adventurers and heroes who performed great deeds for the royal family, which should be subtly described as having the likenesses of your players' past characters (if appropriate). Two can be pushed aside easily for access to the secret passages.

Vault Watchers. Guarding the way to the royal vaults and crypts are two @UUID[Actor.rtGZYM6MiHuRvsQz]{Stone Golems}. The steward once attempted to take control of them, but ended up scrambling the arcane commands that bound them to the castle. They haltingly stumble around their posts and attack anyone who enters.

Royal Vaults

The wealth of Westemär rests behind these large, tightly sealed iron doors: there are no handles, locks, hinges, or seams. Each chamber is warded with @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.NJgxf7pmSsBArIG7]; the doors are @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8cse7rit0oswRPUP]{Arcane Locked} and immune to all damage. The vault doors slide open when touched by one who wears the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.CroT000000000022], or three characters attuned to the Seals of Drakkenheim.

  • The royal vaults contain an incredible treasure of nearly 35,000 gold pieces in heavy gold bullion and silver talents, neatly stacked.
  • A gemstone collection of 6 emeralds, 4 diamonds, 7 rubies, and 8 sapphires, worth 1,000 gp each. Resting as the crowning jewel amongst these is the Diamond of Mount Kadath.
  • A collection of magically notarized, preserved, and sealed bonds, credit notes, financial agreements, and property deeds involving staggering sums and distant foreign powers. These pieces of paper are the true wealth of House von Kessel.
  • Jewelry boxes containing a sapphire amulet, diamond necklace, sapphire tiara, and a ruby-encrusted circlet each worth 2,500 gp.
  • The final chamber houses one very rare magic item and one rare magic item of your choice, and a scroll of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.jhhT9PsHy5A7EojO].

Monarchal Crypt

The royal mausoleum is a fifty-foot-high chamber supported by two dozen rectangular columns. Gargantuan delerium crystals have breached through the walls and floors, and thick delerium sludge fills the hall to the knee's height, bubbling and hissing like a foul stew. The air is cold and stale.

Upon the sides of each pillar are five decorated niches roughly eight feet tall each. They are placed one atop another and separated by ornate borders. Some are empty, but many others hold a life-sized sculpture of a former monarch of Drakkenheim. Each is cast with a regal countenance and idealized features; each holds an object symbolizing their legacy and is flanked by candelabras. Horrifyingly, the outer shells of the statues are crumbling away, revealing exposed muscle and weeping tissue beneath. Some murmur from mouths half-stone and half-flesh. Rays of prismatic light illuminate the chamber from a bulbous form that floats and bobs between the pillars.

  • The @UUID[Actor.JAlnVDDPGe7C5nFG] attacks if it detects any trespassers in this chamber.
  • Delerium sludge floods the floor - characters within must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw at the start of their turn. They take [[/damage 12d6 necrotic average]] damage on a failed saving throw, and half as much on a successful one. In addition, characters who fail the saving throw gain one level of contamination.
  • A plaque below each statue names each monarch with dates of their life and rule, beginning with King Vladimir von Drakken and ending with Queen Helena von Kessel II, Ulrich IV's mother. There are roughly sixty monarchs interred here across five distinct family dynasties. with reigns ranging from decades to days. Behind each statue is a small sealed sepulcher that holds their skulls and ashes. The outer walls are lined with covered sepulchral drawers holding the remains of other royal family members.

Foundation Pillar

A large alcove on the left-hand side of the chamber features a heavily damaged granite pillar. Unlike the others, it is cylindrical, etched with arcane runes, and appears on the brink of collapse. However, the deep cracks are held together by pulsing tendrils of living stone emerging from a peculiar lump of melted rock latched to the pillar like a leech.

  • The Foundation Pillar is the power source for the castle wards. It is magically connected to the Seals of Drakkenheim, the Throne of Drakkenheim, and the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.CroT000000000022]. These magic items lose their magical properties if the Foundation Pillar is destroyed.
  • The dimensional rift is drawing out its immense magic to fuel its growth. If the steward wasn't holding the pillar together to slow this process, the rift would destructively spill open and destroy the castle.
  • Johann Eisner fled here after failing to save Ulrich IV when the Haze overtook Castle Drakken fifteen years ago, He was about to undergo a monstrous transformation when he laid his hands upon the foundation pillar. He has become fused to it as a result, and this accident granted him limited control over its magic. He can't be freed without slaying him, except by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz] spell. A creature within five feet of the foundation pillar can see his face merged within the melted rock. The steward can speak in a halting whisper to characters here.
  • The foundation pillar has AC 20 and 250 hit points. It is immune to fire, poison, and psychic damage, and bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapon attacks.
  • If Eisner is freed from the pillar while the dimension rift remains open, the foundation pillar crumbles in twenty four hours, and Castle Drakken is destroyed by the rift.

Developments.name: 发展
Developments.text:
“The power of a single seal is multiplied when the noble few take up the cause to bring unity and hope to this crumbling city. If only that was all that's needed to restore what we've lost here...”

— Veo Sjena

Developments

Possible outcomes for events directly involving Castle Drakken are summarized below, while the next chapter, the “Fate of Drakkenheim” details possible conclusions for the campaignas a whole.

Closing the Dimensional Rift

The rift can be sealed in three ways:

  • A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz] spell (such as one used from the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.CroT000000000022]).
  • Investing the power of the Seals of Drakkenheim into the steward (see Eternal Custodian).
  • Physically travelling into the rift and destroying the @UUID[Actor.FaQBcQeboMfO6hOL] again on the other side.

The Haze will eventually tear open more rifts as it expands beyond the city, but this is the only one in Drakkenheim... for now.

Beyond the Dimensional Rift

The Space Between Worlds is a roiling non-place. The rift manifests on the other side as an abrupt tear in the peripheral perception. A pernicious beam of multihued light stretches across the effulgent sky, marking a distant place beyond an impossible horizon where the @UUID[Actor.FaQBcQeboMfO6hOL]'s multitudinous manifestations converge. There is no meaningful concept of time in the Space Between Worlds - it is beyond the perception of mortal creatures - so reaching that place is a journey of eons that unfolds in only [[/r 1d10]] minutes of time in the mortal world. Nevertheless, should an intrepid band make the journey and destroy the @UUID[Actor.FaQBcQeboMfO6hOL] here as well, the dimensional rift closes one round of apparent time later. Any characters left behind in the Space Between Worlds must find another means back, but the scope of such adventures is beyond this book.

Eternal Custodian

Johann Eisner believes Drakkenheim is forever cursed, and has resigned himself to be its jailer. When he meets the characters, Eisner explains how it might be possible for him to close the dimensional rift if he is invested with the power of the Seals of Drakkenheim:

  • Accomplishing this task requires each of the six Seals of Drakkenheim and the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.CroT000000000022] to be pressed against the foundation pillar.
  • This will attune Eisner to the Seals, but won't grant him the full powers of the throne or the crown since a coronation ritual isn't performed. He is only able to pacify the wall gargoyles and tower dragons so they don't attack humanoid creatures anymore, but instead attack monsters who come near. However, he is able to use this power to close the dimension rift.
  • If Eisner dies or another creature attunes to the crown, the rift reopens.

Coronation Ceremony

This special ceremony takes two hours to perform and requires seven participants. During this time, one participant (the “heir”) must sit upon the Throne of Drakkenheim wearing the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.CroT000000000022]. The other six participants must each be attuned to a different Seal of Drakkenheim. The ritual fails immediately if any participant becomes incapacitated, moves more than thirty feet away from the throne, or if the heir does not remain seated on the throne for the duration.

One after the other, each participant attuned to a Seal must approach the throne, pledge their allegiance, and offer their lifelong service to the new monarch. Each then makes a DC 20 ability check using an ability score that corresponds to their Seal of Drakkenheim:

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.LorT000000000018] (Strength)
  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.SteT000000000021] (Constitution)
  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.SpyT000000000020] (Dexterity)
  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.InsT000000000017] of the Archmage (Intelligence)
  • High Flamekeeper's Phylactery (Wisdom)
  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.ChaT000000000016] (Charisma)

The designated heir responds to each ability check by making an appropriate check of their own using the same ability score. While all 12 checks must be attempted to finish the ceremony, only 8 successful check results are needed to successfully complete it and attune the heir to the crown. Encourage each character participating in the ritual to roleplay out their vow,and the response of the monarch to each.

Since the throne is contaminated, each failed ability check causes the designated heir to immediately take [[/damage 4d6 psychic average]] damage. In addition, they must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or take an additional [[/damage 3d6 necrotic average]] damage and gain one level of contamination. Failure by 5 or more causes the heir to take [[/damage 10d6 average]] damage and gain [[/r 1d4]] levels of contamination instead. Remember, a creature can't regain hit points while seated on the throne! If the heir is transformed into a monster or reduced to 0 hit points, they immediately transform into another @UUID[Actor.FaQBcQeboMfO6hOL].

NOTE: Not every Seal needs to be worn by a player character: the characters might choose one or more faction leaders or other key non-player characters to wear the Seals. In such cases, these NPCs should offer their hopes for the future, express their gratitude to the player characters, and celebrate their accomplishments. You might even allow the players to make dice rolls for them.

Be careful what you wish for...

No matter how carefully worded, it's well beyond the power of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz] to instantaneously or fully cleanse Drakkenheim of all contamination, delerium, and the Haze. A wish can restore the original form of a single creature who suffered a monstrous transformation, however.

Lost Seals

Characters foolish enough to offer a Seal of Drakkenheim to the devils have effectively doomed any hope for restoring the throne properly. Perhaps such characters could mount an expedition to Hell to retrieve the Seal on an adventure of your own creation!

Chapter 10 - The Fate of Drakkenheim.name: 第十章：德拉肯海姆的命运

The Fate of Drakkenheim.name: 德拉肯海姆的命运
The Fate of Drakkenheim.text:
第十章：德拉肯海姆的命运

玩家角色们的行动引导了德拉肯海姆的冒险，所以在这里，我们不会给出故事的确切结局。每个角色的个人任务都需要完成，但当战役结束时，有两个主要问题尤其亟待解决：如何处理妄质？谁将主宰德拉肯海姆？

Resolving Personal Quests.name: 解决个人任务
Resolving Personal Quests.text:
当你们的角色准备结束他们的个人任务时，他们应该仔细考虑以下内容：

寻找治疗。 治愈的代价是什么？角色们是找到了类似 @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.SipT000000000011] 这样的新法术，还是通过使用维斯特玛王冠施展了 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz]{祈愿术}？

夺取王位。 如果成功夺取了王位，那么这位新君主可以使用王冠的力量施展三次 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz]{祈愿术}。他们打算使用这股力量做什么？

灾难幻象。 在目睹妄质之心的幻象后，角色们决定做些什么？为什么他们要这样做？

派系野心家。 角色在他们派系里的地位如日中天。或许他应该担负起职责，接过派系领袖的衣钵？

项上人头。 大仇得报换来的是什么？

奥术秘密。 角色解放了超乎想象的魔法力量。他们将如何利用这些知识？他们接下来又将发现什么黑暗的新法术？

枯败之地。 角色最终取得了什么发现？他们获得的这些知识将如何帮助他们解决围绕德拉肯海姆的冲突？

家族事务。 这名角色最终回到了他的挚爱身边，还是在这场冲突中付出了自己的代价？

负债压身。 即使债务被还清，也并不代表这件事能彻底翻篇。角色的债务人之后还会要求他们带来什么样的恩惠、履行什么样的义务？

丢失的传家宝。 这件传家宝会有什么样的神秘力量或奇异属性？

个人朝圣。 在这神圣秩序里角色身处于什么样的位置？他们会来拯救这些地方，还是仅仅看它最后一眼？

怪物杀手。 吟游诗人会以怎样的诗篇来称颂这个角色的功绩？

Defeated Factions.name: 被挫败的派系
Defeated Factions.text:
派系可以被各种各样的方法一举摧毁。最起码的，派系的领导者得被除掉，它们的下级成员要被遣散，并且得把他们全都从据点里驱逐。然而，其他有创造性的解决办法也是可行的。也许角色们可以通过揭示流星坠落的真相来帮助天火信众改变白银骑士团的看法，让他们相信卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯的话是真的。也许他们向紫晶学院提供了无可辩驳的证据，让法师们相信试图控制妄质是一件非常危险的事情。为盗贼女王工作的角色可能会编织出一张阴谋之网，从阴影中掌控覆影明灯。你的角色们如何完成这些戏剧性的反转，取决于他们的尝试和你的决断！

即使一时落败，派系在遥远的地方也有其他据点，新招募的军团，雄厚的储备资源，以及德拉肯海姆之外的其他盟友。然而，在德拉肯海姆的败退为派系带来了沉重打击。在他们卷土重来复仇之前，他们至少需要一年的时间来重整势态，选拔新的领袖，制定一个全新的战略。你可能会选择在这个胜利的时刻结束这场战役，因为未来的冲突火花可能已经迫在眉睫。

或许，你可以将战役升级到更高层次。如果这样做，请先给角色们一点时间去制定未来的计划，以奔赴其他的冒险，并让他们得到一些应得的休整。当冒险如此超出了本书的范围时，可以考虑以下剧情发展：

  • 白银骑士团的至高圣武士派遣了一只全新的远征军来围攻德拉肯海姆。他们调动了伊利瑞亚的全部军事力量，并且寻求了一些维斯特玛宗教贵族的援助，组建了一个新的联盟。
  • 紫晶学院的理事会制定了宏大的计划以确保重新获得对妄质的掌控权。他们会编织出强大的法术，动用具有可怕力量的魔法造物，采取狡诈的手段对冒险者们施以报复。
  • 一个神秘人接过了盗贼女王的衣钵，编织出了一张更大的阴谋之网。或许所谓盗贼女王本身，也只是另一位神秘的幕后操纵者设计的复杂阴谋中的一环？
  • 受卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯的殉道激发，一批新的门徒和侍僧鼓动信徒们投入到了一场激进的朝圣之旅中。新一轮的宗教冲突可能会让整片大陆陷入燃烧。
  • 覆影明灯覆灭时那些无能贵族的袖手旁观激怒了维斯特玛的人民，人们集结在了一位富有魅力的反抗领袖身边——他承诺，他会为人们创造一个民主的未来。

Epilogues.name: 后记
Epilogues.text:
以下是关于如何结束德拉肯海姆战役的一些可能的结局和建议，以及随之而来的后果。每一个都为战役提供了一个戏剧性的结局，并且每个后记都提供了一个不确定的未来。这些结局都不是互相排斥的！你的玩家们可以设计一个创造性的解决方案，结合几种不同的可能性。

收复王座

虽然世界确实受到宇宙力量的威胁，但与目前席卷整个大陆的政治动荡相比，这些问题可能显得遥远而超然。谁能掌控德拉肯海姆，谁就能获得巨大的影响力，足以决定权力的平衡。当盗贼女王密谋利用这种情况为自己谋利时，覆影明灯则迫切希望找到一个潜在的王位继承人并确保为他们加冕的方法。这个继承人是谁由你决定：详见第2章"失踪已久的继承人"部分。

证明继承权

找到继承人是一回事；但证明继承人的皇室血统是另一回事。继承人可能通过破碎的挂坠盒、胎记、印章戒指或其他文件来确认身份，但这必须用废墟中的某些东西来证实。有三处可能找到这样的证据：

  • 圣维特鲁维奥大教堂的墓室。
  • 德拉肯城堡总管的档案室。
  • 盗贼女王的私人办公室。

由你决定证据的确切性质。它可以包括详细列出继承顺序的家谱、指定下一位继承人的皇室遗嘱、可用于魔法仪式确认关系的保存皇室血液的小瓶、授予私生子合法地位的未寄出信件、揭露不忠的丑闻文件，或是破碎挂坠盒的另一半。无论如何，它应该是切实且无可辩驳的真实物品。如果角色尚未找到继承人，这些文件也可以揭示他们的身份和位置。

派系支持。王位继承人几乎肯定需要两个或更多派系的支持，以获得赢得贵族支持所需的政治和军事力量。这不一定是覆影明灯，但他们是个稳妥的选择。

加冕

@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.CroT000000000022]和德拉肯海姆王座不仅仅是政治概念：它们也是强大的魔法物品。然而，要解锁这些物品的全部能力，需要使用六枚德拉肯海姆信物在德拉肯城堡举行特殊的加冕仪式（见第9章）。不幸的是，德拉肯海姆王座被污霭腐蚀意味着如果王位继承人不够强大，很可能会在这个过程中死亡——除非你的玩家巧妙地使用保护性法术！

从技术上讲，这些神器并不是统治维斯特玛的新君主必需的，但持有这些物品可以决定性地将潜在的王位继承人置于政治权力的宝座上。一位坐在德拉肯海姆王座上的合法统治者将能够再次团结维斯特玛的贵族，但没有这些物品的人将更难获得更广泛贵族的尊重与合作。

改朝换代

艾利亚斯·德雷克希尔和覆影明灯认为，恢复德拉肯海姆和维斯特玛王国需要冯·凯赛尔家族的后裔坐在德拉肯海姆王座上。然而，细心的角色可能会注意到，至少有四个家族在冯·凯赛尔家族之前统治过德拉肯海姆。因此，另一个贵族家族只要拥有确保权力所需的财富、政治影响力和军事力量，就可以提出主张。这个家族将建立一个新的皇室王朝来统治维斯特玛。

这样的任务需要证明与上一个王朝的某种联系（如上所述），至少三个派系的政治支持，以及掌握皇室宝藏的权力。特别无畏的英雄们可能根本不喜欢君主制的想法。如果你的角色有建立新政府形式的野心，接受它，但不要让他们轻易成功！

女王之堡

如果盗贼女王成功获得了@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.CroT000000000022]，她将利用它的力量巩固对废墟的统治。如果你选择将盗贼女王描绘为卡塔琳娜·冯·凯赛尔，她的第一个愿望是关闭次元裂缝，第二个愿望是复活她死去的妹妹，第三个愿望是抹去关于她魔法能力的公众认知。然后她揭露真实身份以合法统治德拉肯海姆。卡塔琳娜·冯·凯赛尔是否是个好统治者尚不确定，但她证明了自己是个精明的政治家。毫无疑问，她的政治野心不会止于维斯特玛。

火中涅槃

白银骑士团坚持认为必须摧毁德拉肯海姆的所有妄质以避免末日，但完成这样的任务是否可能尚不确定。相反，天火信众坚信妄质提供了救赎的关键，但这种神圣变革需要成千上万的人前往德拉肯海姆朝圣。两个派系都认为他们可以通过复活传说中的圣火先驱来实现目标。

圣维特鲁维奥大教堂地下躺着远古金龙阿贡纳斯的遗骨。虽然这条龙已经死了五百多年，但圣维特鲁维奥宣称，在城市的至暗时刻，一个虔诚的灵魂可以对龙的遗骸施展@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.jhhT9PsHy5A7EojO]使其复活。然而，这个目的需要更强大的宝石：卡达斯山宝钻、德拉肯城堡皇家拱顶中的无价宝石，或是从陨石坑妄质之心取出的原始妄质晶簇。

复活后，阿贡纳斯只会听从拥有所有维特鲁维奥圣遗物的人的话。否则，它就会继续沉睡。

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.SaiT000000000027]，可在圣维特鲁维奥大教堂找到
  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.IgnT000000000023]，密封在大教堂地下墓穴中
  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.TheT000000000026]，可在德拉肯城堡的皇家公寓找到
  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.HelT000000000025]，位于圣赛莉娜修道院的地下室
  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.SceT000000000024]，位于圣布伦娜小教堂

龙焰的净化

如果被白银骑士团复活，阿贡纳斯会帮助骑士们将德拉肯海姆夷为平地。摧毁废墟中所有的妄质是一项不朽的伟业，但在远古金龙的力量帮助下可能实现。阿贡纳斯的火焰造成光耀伤害，而非火焰伤害。

一个合适的高潮可能是玩家角色骑着阿贡纳斯与白银骑士团一起冲入陨石坑，在那里他们为摧毁妄质之心而战。如果成功，污霭将在未来二十年内逐渐消失。当许多怪物变得胆怯、迷雾慢慢消退时，变化就会显现。更小的妄质仍会出现，但必要的清理工作足以应付。白银骑士团坚定地维持对城市的控制直到工作完成，尽管其他派系（尤其是紫晶学院和天火信众）几乎肯定会继续反对他们的努力。一旦每一丝污染被清除，人们就可以回到德拉肯海姆重建城市。不幸的是，除非新君主在另一座城市确立地位（见上文"收复王座"），否则维斯特玛的政治前景将很严峻。在德拉肯海姆重建之前，国家就会分裂成十几个交战的行省。

阴影与救赎

如果阿贡纳斯被天火信众复活，信徒们会用巨龙赶走白银骑士团和紫晶学院。此后，阿贡纳斯守护着德拉肯海姆，保护前来加入天火教派的朝圣者。卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯将在百岁生日前几个月去世，但临终前她会写下最后遗嘱。它确认最深的阴影尚未到来，但在最彻底的黑暗中，神圣之火必将再次燃起。

如果有像玩家角色这样有魅力的门徒崛起取代她的位置领导天火信众，这个新生宗教就会传播开来。新皈依者陆续来到德拉肯海姆接受圣礼——先是数百，后是数千，然后是更多。天火教派继续面临主流神职人员的强烈迫害，但阿贡纳斯被一群所谓的异教徒复活的事实动摇了俗众眼中的信仰根基。最终，数百万人前来寻求在新神圣秩序中的位置。这些人死后，他们的金色灵魂妄质晶石会积聚在陨石坑中。然而，德拉肯海姆永远不会真正重建；废墟被视为圣地。

天火信众不阻止新妄质的形成，污霭蔓延有增无减。信徒们在世界几十年间慢慢陷入混乱时坚守道路。神圣化的信徒可能在污霭中幸存，但随着整个世界被雾气吞噬，怪物会变得强大而可怕。就连强大的阿贡纳斯最终也可能陨落。当世界开始分崩离析时，最后一位天火教派信徒将在聚集了数百万正义灵魂的金色妄质晶体前完成圣礼。那一刻，卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯的预言可能实现，也可能不会。无论如何，世界将在多彩光芒中经历新的神化。

隔绝之城

紫晶学院想利用妄质的奥术力量，并相信他们能控制其中的危险。埃德瑞克·符文织者设计了一个强大无比的@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.jmfu8zj4zjjzUbeh]{虹光法墙}法术版本，大到足以形成容纳整个城市的遏制穹顶。这是个严密保守的秘密，在万事俱备前他不会透露这个计划。

如此戏剧性的魔法力量展示对紫晶学院是重大政治风险。没有德拉肯海姆新君主的支持，或维斯特玛现存权威的充分支持，他们不会执行这个计划。大法师们声称这个屏障是最终恢复德拉肯海姆的最大希望：它将让紫晶学院仔细提取妄质，用于制造魔法物品并出售给任何买得起的人。紫晶学院声称一旦所有妄质被开采完毕，他们将降下屏障帮助重建城市。

这个法术需要巨大的奥术力量来启动和维持：

  • 莫测之塔中枢作为法术的支点。需要莫测之杖来重新激活和控制中枢。
  • 角色必须在中枢安装合适的本地能源：从陨石坑妄质之心取出的原始妄质晶簇。此后每天需提供新的妄质水晶维持法术。
  • 必须在妄质之心安装特殊的奥术虹吸装置，引导其力量增强法术。
  • 8名能施展5环或更高环阶法术的奥术施法者必须参与仪式。至少1名能施展9环法术。

当然，玩家角色被要求执行这些计划并参与施法，这可能会引发敌对派系的最后破坏企图。一旦施放，这个法术确实强大到足以阻止污霭扩张，有效地将德拉肯海姆变成紫晶学院随意采集和研究妄质的温室。此后，只有学院法师及其指定盟友能通过屏障。少数拾荒者和掠夺者找到秘密隧道和隐藏入口，偶尔有怪物通过河流或地下通道逃出。城市仍然危险，但基本被巨大的虹光屏障隔离。然而，学院不是露天开采妄质，而是精心培育它。屏障无限期存在，因为学院有意让更多妄质在其中生长以维持供应。紫晶学院利用新获得的财富和影响力秘密重塑大陆的政治命运，甚至可能瓦解《炉明法令》。

然而，如果虹光屏障因破坏或疏忽而倒塌，结果将是灾难性的。反馈力会摧毁莫测之塔，导致污霭向外猛烈爆炸数百英里。不稳定的魔法极大加速污霭扩张，世界将在几年内毁灭。

无政府状态的德拉肯海姆

在持续冲突中，可能只有怪物和混乱统治着废墟。也许上述几个计划都失败了，没有可靠的继承人幸存，玩家角色和派系决定最好放弃德拉肯海姆。新统治者可能决定以另一座城市作为维斯特玛的首都。除非他们同时具备政治智慧和军事实力，否则维斯特玛很可能分裂成几个较小的王国。事实上，除非玩家角色干预，否则这是最可能的结果，尽管需要几十年的阴谋、背叛和战争。

到那时，随着污霭规模越来越大，德拉肯海姆的情况可能变得更加可怕。大约十年后，当更多次元裂缝和更可怕的怪物在陨石坑中苏醒时，遏制将变得几乎不可能。少数人可能冷漠地认为毁灭还要几个世纪才会到来，污霭是后代要继承的问题。其他有权有势的隐士可能自私地计划逃往其他世界自救。或许新一代充满希望的英雄会在为时已晚前团结起来拯救世界。

妄质法师

"这个城市不是漫无目的的人该来的地方，但有些人的目标能在这里找到。"

——塞巴斯蒂安·克劳

@UUID[Actor.Xiknv4R8i7dxqqL7]{Gutbuster}

@UUID[Actor.QLve30GX7Zb3nN7a]{Hunter}

@UUID[Actor.H4eFETYZ4F5mDIwr]{Juggernaut}

Ratling.name: 鼠怪
Ratling.text:
Ratlings

A pair of glinting yellow-purple eyes appear down the dark tunnel ahead, then another, then more. A scurrying mass of furry bodies bound up in mud-spattered cloth and greasy leather surge forward. Their rodent-like claws brandish rust-caked blades as many squeaking voices erupt into a cacophony of chittering, chirping, screeching, and finally a howl of “Kill! Kill! Kill!”

Ratlings are oversized mutated rats imbued with malevolent cunning and driven by a mad compulsion to consume and multiply. These wretched monsters suffer from a constant internal struggle between cowardly survival instincts and violent impulsive urges. Ratlings dream of eating everything, and will eat anything, but love eating people. They especially love eating babies. While they will subsist on carrion, ratlings take captives back to their lairs so they can have fresh food later.

Thousands of ratlings dwell in the city. They form warring colonies that dig maze-like burrows featuring multiple entrances and tight looping passages. Successful colonies grow in number quickly, as ratlings mature in a matter of weeks when ample food and delerium are available.

鼠神魔契师

"倘若我们奉上一切亮晶晶的玩意，鼠神大人就会降临，并帮助我们！我们会得到食物！我们能吃！能吃个够！吃数不胜数的食物！我们会把这个世界吃干抹净！整片大地！没错！没错！没错！"

许多鼠怪都崇拜着一个被称为"鼠神"的邪魔存在。这位"鼠神"对那些最狡猾也最聪明的鼠怪发出耳畔低语，通过签订魔能契约赐予它们力量。而离谱的是，鼠怪们根本对祂一无所知，所以它们创造了不少传说与寓言来证明祂曾创下过伟业。

Contaminated Elementals.name: 污染元素
Contaminated Elementals.text:
ContaminatedElementals

污染元素在德拉肯海姆之中随处可见，尤其是是那些骇异魔能汇聚之地。许多遭遇这些元素生物的人都将这些怪物描述为“城市本身活过来攻击我们”的象征。有报告称，废墟如同伸出双手般碾碎了冒险者，燃烧的火焰四下游荡狩猎意识生物，污染的水体蹒跚上地吞噬路人——就连街道上一阵清风吹来的空气也汇聚着污霭，化为变幻莫测的云雾尾随冒险者。这些魔法生物无时不刻都在提醒人们：这座城市里没有任何东西可以被信任，没有任何地方存在真正的安全。

Animated Delerium Sludge.name: 活化妄质污泥
Animated Delerium Sludge.text:
活化妄质污泥

大型元素，无阵营

  • 护甲等级 14（天生护甲）
  • 生命值 114（12d10 + 48）
  • 速度 30 尺，游泳 90 尺
  • 力量18（+4）
  • 敏捷14（+2）
  • 体质18（+4）
  • 智力5（-3）
  • 感知10（+0）
  • 魅力8（-1）
  • 伤害抗性 强酸；非魔法攻击的钝击、穿刺、挥砍
  • 伤害免疫 暗蚀，毒素
  • 状态免疫 力竭，擒抱，麻痹，石化，中毒，倒地，束缚，昏迷
  • 感官 黑暗视觉 60 尺，被动察觉 10
  • 语言 深潜语
  • 挑战等级5（1,800 XP）

污泥形态。 活化污泥可以进入敌对生物所在的空间并停留在那里。它可以穿过一个只有 1 寸宽的狭缝而无需跻身。

动作

污染之触。 近战武器攻击：命中 +7，触及 5 尺，单一目标。命中：10（3d6）暗蚀伤害。此外，被该攻击命中的生物还必须进行一次 DC15 的体质豁免，豁免失败则获得一级污染。

淹没。 身处活化妄质污泥所处空间内的每个生物都必须进行一次 DC15 的力量豁免。若豁免失败，且该生物体型不超过大型，该生物将被污泥擒抱（逃脱 DC14）。以此法被擒抱期间目标还会陷入束缚状态。豁免成功则该生物将被推出污泥所处的空间。

污泥可以同时擒抱一个大型生物，或两个体型不超过中型的生物。在每个污泥的回合开始时，被它擒抱的生物都会受到 28（8d6）暗蚀伤害，然后必须通过一次 DC15 的体质豁免，豁免失败则获得一级污染。

身处污泥周围 5 尺范围内的生物可以尝试用自己的动作将被擒抱的生物拖离污泥。为此，该生物必须成功通过一次 DC14 的力量检定。

Living Deep Haze.name: 活体浓厚污霭
Living Deep Haze.text:
活体浓厚污霭

大型元素，无阵营

  • 护甲等级 15
  • 生命值 90（12d10 + 24）
  • 速度 0 尺，飞行 90 尺（悬浮）
  • 力量14（+2）
  • 敏捷20（+5）
  • 体质14（+2）
  • 智力5（-3）
  • 感知10（+0）
  • 魅力5（-3）
  • 伤害抗性 非魔法攻击的钝击、穿刺、挥砍
  • 伤害免疫 暗蚀，毒素
  • 状态免疫 力竭，擒抱，麻痹，石化，中毒，倒地，束缚，昏迷
  • 感官 黑暗视觉 60 尺，被动察觉 10
  • 语言 深潜语
  • 挑战等级5（1,800 XP）

    • 雾霭形态。 活体浓厚污霭可以进入敌对生物所在的空间并停留在那里。它可以穿过一个只有 1 寸宽的狭缝而无需跻身。

    浓厚污霭。 任何进入活体浓厚污霭所处空间，或在此空间内开始其回合的生物都必须通过一次 DC 15 的体质豁免，豁免失败将受到 10（3d6）暗蚀伤害并获 1 级污染。

动作

多重攻击。 活体浓厚污霭发动两次猛击。

猛击。 近战武器攻击：命中 +8，触及 5 尺，单一目标。命中：14（2d8 + 5）钝击伤害。

Entropic Flame.name: 熵能火焰
Entropic Flame.text:
熵能烈焰

大型元素，无阵营

  • 护甲等级 13
  • 生命值 78（12d10 + 12）
  • 速度 30 尺
  • 力量10（+0）
  • 敏捷17（+3）
  • 体质13（+1）
  • 智力5（-3）
  • 感知10（+0）
  • 魅力5（-3）
  • 伤害抗性 非魔法攻击的钝击、穿刺、挥砍
  • 伤害免疫 火焰，毒素
  • 状态免疫 力竭，擒抱，麻痹，石化，中毒，倒地，束缚，昏迷
  • 感官 黑暗视觉 60 尺，被动察觉 10
  • 语言 深潜语
  • 挑战等级5（1,800 XP）

火焰形态。 熵能烈焰可以通过只有 1 寸宽的狭缝而无需跻身。任何生物触及熵能烈焰，或在熵能烈焰周围 5 尺范围内对熵能烈焰发动近战攻击时将受到 5（1d10）火焰伤害。此外，熵能烈焰可以进入并停留在敌对生物所在的位置。当熵能烈焰在某一回合中第一次进入某生物所处的空间时，该生物将受到 5（1d10）火焰伤害并着火。此后直至有人以一个动作为其扑灭火焰前，该生物在每一个其自身回合开始时受到 5（1d10）火焰伤害。

照明。 熵能烈焰散发出 30 尺半径的明亮光照，以及之外 30 尺的微光光照。

动作

多重攻击。 熵能烈焰发动三次投掷火焰。在每次攻击之前或之后，它都可以传送 10 尺距离到一处它可见的空间内。它能以此法传送至一处已被生物占据的空间中。

投掷火焰。 远程武器攻击：命中 +6，射程 120 尺，单一目标。命中：10（3d6）火焰伤害。

触击。 近战武器攻击：命中 +6，触及 5 尺，单一目标。命中：10（2d6+3）火焰伤害。如果目标是一个生物或可燃的物件，目标将被点燃。此后直至有生物用动作扑灭该目标身上的火焰前，该目标在每一个其自身回合开始时受到 5（1d10）火焰伤害。

Walking Delerium Geode.name: 自走妄质晶簇
Walking Delerium Geode.text:
自走妄质晶簇

大型元素，无阵营

  • 护甲等级 17（天生护甲）
  • 生命值 126（12d10 + 60）
  • 速度 30 尺，掘穴 30 尺
  • 力量20（+5）
  • 敏捷8（-1）
  • 体质20（+5）
  • 智力5（-3）
  • 感知10（+0）
  • 魅力5（-3）
  • 伤害易伤 光耀、雷鸣
  • 伤害抗性 非魔法攻击的钝击、穿刺、挥砍
  • 伤害免疫 暗蚀、毒素
  • 状态免疫 力竭、麻痹、石化、中毒、昏迷
  • 感官 黑暗视觉 60 尺，震颤感知 60 尺，被动察觉 10
  • 语言 深潜语
  • 挑战等级5（1,800 XP）

自爆。 如果有伤害将自走妄质晶簇的生命值降至 0（光耀、力场、雷鸣伤害除外），晶簇体内的妄质晶体就会爆裂而出，形成一股污染能量的爆炸。每个身处晶簇周围 30 尺范围内的生物都必须通过一次 DC15 的体质豁免，豁免失败将受到 42（12d6）暗蚀伤害并获得一级污染。此外，这一爆炸还会触发一道随机的@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.tables.RollTable.pPGtKhPFFcHortCT]{奥术异常}（见附录 D）。

遁地。 自走妄质晶簇可以掘穴穿过非魔法且未经加工的泥土及岩石中移动。以此使用掘穴速度时，自走妄质晶簇不会破坏其穿过的任何材质。

动作

碎晶猛击。 近战武器攻击：命中 +8，触及 10 尺，单一目标。命中：14（2d8+5）钝击伤害。被此攻击命中的生物还必须通过一 DC15 的体质豁免，豁免失败将受到 10（3d6）暗蚀伤害并获得一层污染等级。

"这些色彩固然迷人，但在我看来，它们蕴含的炼金特性和法术可能性才更为迷人。"

——塞巴斯蒂安·克劳

Hypnotic Eldritch Blossom.name: 催眠魔花
Hypnotic Eldritch Blossom.text:
催眠魔花

污霭中孕育着奇异的新生命。这些五彩斑斓的花朵会释放致幻花粉，并分泌被污染的花蜜。它们常被误认为是普通的魔花而带来致命后果。

催眠魔花

中型植物，混乱邪恶

  • 护甲等级 5
  • 生命值 18（4d8）
  • 速度 5 尺
  • 力量3（-4）
  • 敏捷1（-5）
  • 体质10（+0）
  • 智力1（-5）
  • 感知3（-4）
  • 魅力5（-3）
  • 状态免疫 目盲，耳聋，恐慌
  • 感官 盲视 30 尺（超过此范围则目盲），被动察觉 6
  • 语言 —
  • 挑战等级1（200 XP）

拟形。 只要催眠魔花保持静止不动，没有任何方法能区分出它和一株普通花朵的区别。

动作

污化花蜜。 催眠魔花选择周围 10 尺范围内它可见的一个生物，该生物必须通过一次DC 10 的体质豁免，豁免失败将获得一级污染。

催眠花粉（短休或长休后充能）。 催眠魔花向周围释放出闪烁的催眠花粉，花粉云将覆盖其周围半径 30 尺的区域。任何处于这片区域的生物必须通过一次 DC 10 的感知豁免，否则将将被催眠魔花魅惑 1 分钟。以此法被魅惑期间，该生物还会陷入失能状态，且在其回合中它必须用自己的全部移动力来尽可能尝试靠近催眠魔花。

此效应会在生物受到任何伤害，或其他生物使用一个动作将其摇醒时提前终止。

反应

法术反射。 若催眠魔花对抗某一法术的豁免成功，且该法术的目标有且仅有催眠魔花一个生物（且不具有区域性的魔法效应），或当一次以它为目标的法术攻击未命中时，魔花可以选择让另一个、它周围 30 尺范围内的、它可见的生物（可以是施法者本人）代替催眠魔花承受这一法术的效应。如果法术迫使生物进行一次豁免，则该生物必须为自己进行一次豁免；如果法术是一次攻击，那次攻击检定需要重新投掷（此时攻击目标为代替承受的那个生物）。

"它的颜色很迷人，但在我看来，它的炼金术性质和用在法术中的可能性要迷人得多。"

——塞巴斯蒂安·克劳

Amalgamation.name: 融而为一之物
Amalgamation.text:
Amalgamation

Formed only in places where dimensional rifts are torn open, this blasphemous abomination is a conduit by which beings from realms of chaos untold can enter our world. It is an interdimensional cancer which infects our earth.”

- Eldrick Runeweaver

Amalgamation

Gargantuan aberration, chaotic evil

  • Armour Class 18 (natural armour)
  • Hit Points 525 (30d20 + 210)
  • Speed 5 ft.
  • STR30 (+10)
  • DEX11 (+0)
  • CON27 (+7)
  • INT22 (+6)
  • WIS 18 (+4)
  • CHA20 (+5)
  • Saving Throws Str +17, Dex +7, Con +14, Int +13, Wis +11
  • Damage Immunities psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
  • Condition Immunities charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, stunned
  • Skills Arcana +13, Deception +12, Insight +11, Perception +11
  • Senses truesight 120 ft., passive Perception 21
  • Languages all, telepathy 1 mile
  • Challenge 23 (50,000 XP)

Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If the amalgamation fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Malignancy. The amalgamation can't be teleported or travel to another plane against its will.

Immutable Form. The amalgamation is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

Magic Weapons. The amalgamation's weapon attacks are magical.

Innate Spellcasting. The amalgamation's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 20). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

At will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ppWAAEul0QHtm4er], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8]

Actions

Multiattack. The amalgamation uses its Contaminating Presence. It then makes three tentacle attacks, each of which it can replace with one use of Fling.

Bite. Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (3d8 + 10) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature grappled by the amalgamation, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends.

While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the amalgamation, and it takes 42 (12d6) acid damage and gains one level of contamination at the start of each of the amalgamation's turns.

If the amalgamation takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the amalgamation must succeed on a DC 25 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the amalgamation. If the amalgamation dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

Tentacle. Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 50 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 18). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The amalgamation has twelve tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

Fling. One Large or smaller object held or creature grappled by the amalgamation is thrown up to 60 feet in a direction of the amalgamation's choice and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

Mind-breaking Whispers. The amalgamation utters a terrible truth within the mind of one creature within 120 feet of it. That creature must succeed on a DC 20 Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, it takes 35 (10d6) psychic damage and becomes insane until it finishes a long rest. While insane, it can't take actions, can't understand what other creatures say, can't read, and can speak only in gibberish. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WzvJ7G3cqvIubsLk] spell cast on the creature ends this effect.

Contaminating Presence. Humanoid creatures within 120 feet of the amalgamation must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (3d6) necrotic damage and gain one level of contamination.

Legendary Actions

The amalgamation can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The amalgamation regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

  • Tentacle Attack or Fling. The amalgamation makes one tentacle attack or uses its Fling.
  • Mind-breaking Whispers (Costs 2 Actions). The amalgamation uses Mind-breaking Whispers.
  • Piper at the Gate (Costs 3 Actions). Up to five @UUID[Actor.gwrdsxHSdMxcmK79]{Gibbering Mouthers} appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of the amalgamation and remain until destroyed. These creatures act after the amalgamation on the same initiative count and are under its control. The amalgamation can have up to ten @UUID[Actor.gwrdsxHSdMxcmK79]{Gibbering Mouthers} summoned by this ability at a time.

Crimson Countess.name: 猩红女伯爵
Crimson Countess.text:
猩红女伯爵

猩红女伯爵是一位强大的鸟妖族长，有着引人注目的猩红色羽毛与头发。她总是身着黑金相间的铠甲，手中提着她那迸射着电能的矛枪。

猩红女伯爵

中型怪兽，混乱邪恶

  • 护甲等级 17（天生护甲）
  • 生命值 130（20d8 + 40）
  • 速度 20 尺，飞行 60 尺
  • 力量10（+0）
  • 敏捷21（+5）
  • 体质15（+2）
  • 智力13（+1）
  • 感知14（+2）
  • 魅力19（+4）
  • 豁免 体质 +5，感知 +5
  • 技能 杂技 +11，欺瞒 +7，察觉 +8
  • 伤害免疫 闪电，雷鸣
  • 感官 黑暗视觉 120 尺，被动察觉 16
  • 语言 深渊语
  • 挑战等级8（3,900 XP）

舞空者。 猩红女伯爵在每个她的回合中都可以用附赠动作执行疾走，撤离或回避动作。

敏锐视觉。 猩红女伯爵在基于视觉的感知（察觉）检定中具有优势。

动作

多重攻击。 猩红女伯爵使用其骇人尖啸。她随后使用她的禽爪或标枪发动两次攻击。

禽爪。 近战武器攻击：命中 +8，触及 5 尺，单一目标。命中：11（1d10+5）挥砍伤害。

骇人尖啸。 任何由猩红女伯爵选择的位于其 120 尺内且并未耳聋的生物都必须成功通过一次DC 15 的感知豁免否则陷入恐慌状态 1 分钟。若一个生物通过了此效应的豁免或是其身上的此效应结束，则该生物在接下来的 24 小时内免疫猩红女伯爵的骇人尖啸。

以此法被恐慌的生物必须在其回合内执行疾走动作，并以此寻找最安全的路线远离猩红女伯爵，直至其无路可走为止。如果该生物在施法者视线范围外结束其回合，则其可以再进行一次感知豁免，豁免成功则该生物身上的此效应终止。

标枪。 近战或远程武器攻击：命中 +8，触及 5 尺或射程 20/60 尺，单一目标。命中：9（1d6+5）穿刺伤害外加 14（4d6）闪电伤害。

音鸣爆（充能 5-6）。 猩红女伯爵释放出一道雷鸣尖啸，覆盖一处 15 尺矩形区域。任何位于区域内的生物都必须进行通过一次DC 15 的体质豁免，豁免失败则受到 14（4d6）雷鸣伤害，豁免成功则伤害减半。失败于此豁免的生物还会被推开 10 尺并陷入倒地状态。

猩红女伯爵

Executioner.name: 处刑魔机
Executioner.text:
处刑魔机

"......这就是为什么我们不去戮石广场。"

——佩特拉·朗中尉

处刑魔机

处刑魔机

巨型构装生物，守序邪恶

  • 护甲等级 20（天生护甲）
  • 生命值 405（30d12 + 210）
  • 速度 40 尺
  • 力量29（+9）
  • 敏捷11（+0）
  • 体质25（+7）
  • 智力10（+0）
  • 感知11（+0）
  • 魅力10（+0）
  • 豁免 力量 +15，体质 +13，感知 +6
  • 伤害免疫 毒素，心灵；非魔法且非精金攻击的钝击、穿刺、挥砍
  • 状态免疫 魅惑，力竭，恐慌，麻痹，石化，中毒
  • 感官 黑暗视觉 120 尺，被动察觉 10
  • 语言 理解通用语但不会说
  • 挑战等级20（25,000 XP）

传奇抗性（3/日）。 处刑魔机豁免失败时，可以将其改为豁免成功。

不变形态。 处刑魔机免疫任何可以改变其形态的法术或效应。

魔法抗性。 处刑魔机抵抗法术和其他魔法效应时进行的豁免检定具有优势。

魔法武器。 处刑魔机的武器攻击视为魔法攻击。

复生。 如果处刑魔机被摧毁，它将会在 24 小时内恢复其所有的生命值，除非残骸被使用了@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.HBHbOGKNVVprSlwn]法术。

动作

斩首铡刀。 近战或远程武器攻击：命中 +15，触及 10 尺或射程 30/120 尺，单一目标。命中：30（6d6+9）挥砍伤害外加 14（4d6）暗蚀伤害。目标必须成功通过一次DC 21 的体质豁免否则其生命值上限将承受等同该暗蚀伤害数值的减损。减损效应持续至该目标完成一次长休。如果该效应将目标的生命值上限降至 0，则目标死亡。该武器会在发动一次远程攻击之后立即飞回处刑魔机手中。

暗蚀毒气（充能 5-6）。 处刑魔机排出一片暗蚀气体并覆盖自身半径 30 尺的区域，区域内的每个生物都必须进行一次DC 21 的体质豁免，豁免失败者受到 45（10d8）暗蚀伤害，豁免成功则伤害减半。失败于此豁免且差值为 5 或更高的生物还会获得一层污染。

传奇动作

处刑魔机拥有 3 传奇动作，用来选择执行下列动作项。它每次只可选择执行一个传奇动作项，且必须在另一生物回合结束时执行。处刑魔机在其回合开始时恢复所有消耗的传奇动作数。

  1. 撼地前行。 处刑魔机移动等于其速度一半的距离。
  2. 攻击（消耗 2 动作）。 处刑魔机使用其斩首铡刀发动一次近战或远程攻击。
  3. 召唤幽影（消耗 3 动作）。 处刑魔机指定至多六个 60 尺内它可见的因暴力而死的类人生物遗体。每个目标的精魄都将被唤起为一只幽影并出现在其尸体的空间或邻近一处未被占据的空间。这些幽影使用处刑魔机的先攻，并在其回合结束后立即行动。将持续存在直至 1 分钟后或是被摧毁，而处刑魔机被摧毁后幽影也会被摧毁。

"我经常锻炼，但在从戮石广场跑出来后，我还是喘不过气来。"

——普鲁托·杰克逊

Gravekeeper.name: “守墓人”
Gravekeeper.text:
"守墓人"

"德拉肯城堡之下的皇室陵墓中存放着历代国王、王后、公爵还有其它贵族的遗体。曾有许多守墓人悉心照料着那儿的灯火，以期死者能够安全地走向光明......但在如今的这黑暗的时代，我几乎不敢去想那墓穴里会变成什么样子。"

——红狮旅店中偷听到的贵族谈话

@UUID[Actor.JAlnVDDPGe7C5nFG]是一个悬浮在空中的血肉巨物，其上生着许多抽动的附肢。从其诡异可怕的外表中，依稀可以辨认出许多曾是德拉肯城堡守墓人的面孔，然而这些可怜人的面孔都被扭曲地定格在了恐惧之中，其空洞的眼瞳中闪着黯淡的第八虹色之辉。在此之上生长的是数以百计的手臂，其中一些手甚至还提着发光的灯笼。灯笼之中流溢着第八虹色的光焰，雨地下墓穴中投射出闪烁的阴影。"守墓人"徘徊在死者之间，将它们唤醒为贪食的恶魂，从城堡的墓穴中破土而出。

"守墓人"

大型异怪，混乱邪恶

  • 护甲等级 18（天生护甲）
  • 生命值 210（20d10 + 100）
  • 速度 0 尺，飞行 30 尺（悬浮）
  • 力量18（+4）
  • 敏捷7（-2）
  • 体质21（+5）
  • 智力19（+4）
  • 感知17（+3）
  • 魅力21（+5）
  • 豁免 体质 +10，感知 +8，魅力 +10
  • 技能 察觉 +13
  • 感官 真实视觉 120 尺，被动察觉 23
  • 语言 理解全部但不会说
  • 挑战等级13（10,000 XP）

眩目辉色。 "守墓人"投射出一道光环，发出半径 60 尺的明亮光照，并致使对其发动的攻击检定具有劣势。在它受到伤害时，该特性会暂时失效，直至它的下一回合开始。该特性也会在它陷入失能或速度降为 0 时暂时失效。

传奇抗性（3/日）。 "守墓人"豁免失败时，可以将其改为豁免成功。

动作

猛击。 近战武器攻击：命中 +9，触及 10 尺，单一目标。命中：22（4d8+4）钝击伤害外加 10（3d6）暗蚀伤害。

灯影焰爆。 无数道魔法性的第八虹色辉耀射线从"守墓人"的众多提灯中射出。每道射线都有不同的效果。任何位于"守墓人"120 尺内且未处于全身掩护中的生物都必须掷一枚 d6 以决定其被哪一种颜色的射线影响。本特性中的豁免DC 皆为 18：

  1. 灭法焰爆。 目标生物必须成功通过一次智力豁免否则受到 35（10d6）心灵伤害，且目标身上的任何法术或魔法效应都将结束。失败于此豁免的生物还会被打断其正在为法术维持的专注。
  2. 念力焰爆。 目标生物必须成功通过一次力量豁免否则受到 35（10d6）力场伤害，被推离 20 尺并陷入倒地状态。
  3. 致盲焰爆。 目标生物必须成功通过一次体质豁免否则受到 35（10d6）光耀伤害并陷入目盲状态 1 分钟。被目盲的生物可以在每个其回合结束时重复此豁免，豁免成功则其身上的该效应结束。
  4. 污化焰爆。 目标生物必须成功通过一次体质豁免否则受到 35（10d6）暗蚀伤害并获得一级污染。
  5. 焚身焰爆。 目标生物必须成功通过一次敏捷豁免否则受到 35（10d6）火焰伤害且被引燃；目标在每个其回合开始时还会受到 35（10d6）火焰伤害，直至有人用一个动作来为其扑灭火焰。
  6. 急冻焰爆。 目标生物必须成功通过一次体质豁免否则受到 35（10d6）冷冻伤害且其不能执行反应直至其下一回合结束。此外，目标生物也无法在其下一回合里同时执行一个动作与一个附赠动作，而只能两者选其一。豁免成功者受到一半伤害且不受该焰爆的其它效应影响。

传奇动作

"守墓人"拥有 3 传奇动作，用来选择执行下列动作项。它每次只可选择执行一个传奇动作项，且必须在另一生物回合结束时执行。"守墓人"在其回合开始时恢复所有消耗的传奇动作数。

  • 猛击。 "守墓人"发动一次猛击攻击。
  • 闪身。 "守墓人"移动至多等于其速度的距离且不触发借机攻击。
  • 灯影焰爆（消耗 3 动作）。 "守墓人"使用其灯影焰爆。

巢穴动作

于巢穴内战斗时，"守墓人"可以引动环境中的魔法来执行巢穴动作。先攻轮到 20 时（出现等值时视为后手），"守墓人"可执行一个巢穴动作并产生下列效应其一：

  • 一道妄质污泥于地面上喷涌而出，覆盖一处半径 10 尺的柱状区域并喷出至 30 尺高。任何位于污泥区域内的生物都必须进行一次DC 18 的体质豁免。豁免失败则受到 42（12d6）暗蚀伤害，豁免成功则伤害减半。失败于此豁免的生物还会获得一层污染。
  • "守墓人"周边 120 尺内的墙壁开始生出血肉之臂抓向敌人。由"守墓人"指定的生物在这些墙壁周边 10 尺范围内开始其回合时必须成功通过一次DC 15 的敏捷豁免否则被擒抱。以此法被擒抱的生物可以进行一次DC 15 的力量（运动）或敏捷（体操）检定以逃脱。
  • 房间中挂着的一根火把或一盏灯笼中迸发出其灯影焰爆中的一道焰爆选项。

直至所有三项动作用过前，"守墓人"不能再使用已用过的巢穴动作效应。而它也不能在连续的两轮里重复使用同一种效应。

Lord of the Feast.name: 饕餮之主
Lord of the Feast.text:
饕餮之主

这位怖人的白化加米尔犬怪身高超过了 12 英尺。他浑身生着黄白色的脏乱皮毛，其上沾染着无数战斗带来的斑斑血迹与一道道伤痕。他的铠甲由皮革、链条、刀片组成——其上还挂着一颗作为战利品的木乃伊头颅。如骨刺般凌厉且遍布倒钩的灰色鬃毛从他的头顶一路延伸到他那编着颅骨与骨片的白色长尾。他狰狞咆哮的面孔上长满了刀般锋利的獠牙，一对血红的眼瞳镶于其上，如同燃烧一般。@UUID[Actor.CF7PHcpwR43Z2LVS]提着一把越形的长弓，其上系着坚韧的肌腱。他背后的箭袋里满是同样巨大的箭支，有些布满妨碍行动的倒刺，有些连着便于牵扯的锁链，而另一些则使用了妄质晶块作为箭头。

饕餮之主

饕餮之主

大型怪兽，混乱邪恶

  • 护甲等级 18（天生护甲）
  • 生命值 228（24d10 + 96）
  • 速度 30 尺，攀爬 30 尺
  • 力量18（+4）
  • 敏捷18（+4）
  • 体质18（+4）
  • 智力11（+0）
  • 感知18（+4）
  • 魅力13（+1）
  • 豁免 体质 +9，敏捷 +9，感知 +9，魅力 +6
  • 技能 运动 +9，察觉 +14，隐匿 +14，生存 +9
  • 感官 黑暗视觉 120 尺，被动察觉 24
  • 语言 深渊语
  • 挑战等级15（13,000 XP）

传奇抗性（3/日）。 饕餮之主豁免失败时，可以将其改为豁免成功。

再生。 饕餮之主在其回合开始时恢复 20 点生命值，前提是它至少有 1 点生命值。

近身猎手。 位于敌对生物 5 尺内并不会令饕餮之主在远程攻击上获得劣势。

猎兽感知。 饕餮之主在感知（察觉）检定上具有优势。他可以感测 120 尺内所有隐形生物的位置。

动作

多重攻击。 饕餮之主发动三次攻击：每种箭矢各一次，或者一次啃咬和两次爪击。

啃咬。 近战武器攻击：命中 +9，触及 5 尺，单一目标。命中：15（2d10+4）穿刺伤害外加 18（4d8）暗蚀伤害。被该攻击命中的目标必须成功通过一次DC 17 的体质豁免否则获得一级污染。

爪击。 近战武器攻击：命中 +9，触及 10 尺，单一目标。命中：11（2d6+4）挥砍伤害。

污化箭矢。 远程武器攻击：命中 +9，射程 150/600 尺，单一目标。命中：13（2d8+4）穿刺伤害外加 18（4d8）暗蚀伤害。被该攻击命中的目标必须成功通过一次DC 17 的体质豁免否则获得一级污染。

捕杀箭矢。 远程武器攻击：命中 +9，射程 150/600 尺，单一目标。命中：13（2d8+4）穿刺伤害。若目标为大型或更小，则其必须成功通过一次DC 17 的敏捷豁免否则因魔法性的捕杀陷阱而陷入束缚状态 1 分钟。以此法被束缚的生物可以用其动作来重复此豁免，豁免成功则结束此效应。

猎叉箭矢。 远程武器攻击：命中 +9，射程 150/600 尺，单一目标。命中：13（2d8+4）穿刺伤害。若目标为一大型或更小的生物，则其必须成功通过一次DC 17 的力量豁免否则被直线拉向饕餮之主至多 20 尺。

传奇动作

饕餮之主拥有 3 传奇动作，用来选择执行下列动作项。它每次只可选择执行一个传奇动作项，且必须在另一生物回合结束时执行。饕餮之主在其回合开始时恢复所有消耗的传奇动作数。

  • 疾驰。 饕餮之主移动等于其速度的距离且不触发借机攻击。
  • 箭袭（消耗 2 动作）。 饕餮之主用一种箭矢发动一次攻击。
  • 猎杀时刻（消耗 3 动作）。 饕餮之主释放一道令人心肺停止的怒号，响彻整个德拉肯海姆。任何位于饕餮之主 60 尺内的能听到他的加米尔犬怪都可以用其反应移动等于其速度一半的距离并发动一次带有优势的近战或远程武器攻击。

Pale Man.name: “苍白之人”
Pale Man.text:
苍白之人

苍白之人

苍白之人

中型异怪，绝对中立

  • 护甲等级 12（有法师护甲则 15）
  • 生命值 120（16d8 + 48）
  • 速度 30 尺，攀爬 30 尺
  • 力量10 （+0）
  • 敏捷15 （+2）
  • 体质17 （+3）
  • 智力20 （+5）
  • 感知15 （+2）
  • 魅力12 （+1）
  • 豁免 体质 +8，智力 +10，感知 +7
  • 技能 奥秘 +10，察觉 +7，历史 +10
  • 伤害免疫 暗蚀、毒素
  • 伤害抗性 非魔法攻击的钝击、穿刺和挥砍
  • 状态免疫 魅惑、恐慌、麻痹、石化、中毒、束缚
  • 感官 黑暗视觉 60 尺，被动察觉 15
  • 语言 通用语外加其它 5 种语言
  • 挑战等级 13（10,000 XP）

传奇抗性（3 日）。苍白之人豁免失败时，可以将其改为豁免成功。

虫群之躯。 苍白之人可以进驻另一生物身处的空间位置，反之亦然。而且苍白之人可以通过任何足够一只微型昆虫通过的通道。

施法。 苍白之人是一位 16 级施法者，使用智力作为施法属性（法术豁免 DC 18，法术攻击命中 +10）。它准备了以下法师法术：

戏法（随意）：@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.vrN18tbTw7io5MWd]{冻寒之触}， @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Utk1OQRwYkMkFRD3]{法师之手}， @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.kjmjY0zlE6IEiQVL]{修复术}， @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.udsLtG0BugXHR2JQ]{魔法伎俩}， @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XvbiNhNqXXIFisIy]{电爪}

1 环（4 法术位）： @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.DelT000000000004]{妄彩球}， @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.CKZTpZlxj7hjjo2H]{法师护甲}， @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.41JIhpDyM9Anm7cs]{魔法飞弹}，@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.z1mx84ONwkXKUZd7]{护盾术}

2 环（3 法术位）：@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3Lo9boi7P2ro6QV4]{定身类人}， @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.1N8dDMMgZ1h1YJ3B]{隐形术}, @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.WarT000000000012]{扭曲矢}

3 环（3 法术位）：@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Ek45cBpVXvJdv1Qy]{法术反制}， @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.IyikgTEOTv701jgQ]{闪电束}, @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.PurT000000000008]{祛除污染}

4 环（3 法术位）： @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.DelT000000000003]{妄能爆破}, @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.ForT000000000005]{强制进化}

5 环（3 法术位）： @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.ConT000000000000], @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.SipT000000000011]

6 环（1 法术位）：@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.QbTxN5dWIbYZ4jLU]{连锁闪电}

7 环（1 法术位）：@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.OctT000000000007]

8 环（1 法术位）：@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Eon0jzGzQRNluTPQ]{反魔法力场}

蠕行血肉。 当苍白之人被降至 0 生命值时，它崩解为一个占据原先空间的@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.S0zDrv6lbnwWaz9E]{虫群}。除非该集群被摧毁，否则苍白之人会重聚为其虫茧并在 1d6 日后重构。

动作

污化之触。 近战法术攻击： 命中 +8，触及 10 尺，单一目标。 命中：10（3d6）暗蚀伤害，且目标必须成功通过一次 DC 16 的体质豁免否则获得一级污染 Contamination。

蚕食血肉（充能 6）。 任何位于苍白之人 10 尺内的生物都必须成功通过一次 DC 16 的敏捷豁免否则受到 22（5d8）暗蚀伤害并因铺天盖地的血肉虫群而陷入束缚状态。受影响的生物在苍白之人的每个回合开始时都会再受到 22（5d8）暗蚀伤害。受影响的生物可以在每个其回合结束时重复此豁免，豁免成功则结束此效应。

传奇动作

苍白之人拥有 3 传奇动作，用于选择执行下列动作选项。每次执行传奇动作时，每个选项只可以选用一次，且只能在另一生物的回合结束时执行。苍白之人在他的回合开始时恢复其所有已消耗的传奇动作数。

  • 戏法（消耗 1 动作）。 苍白之人施展一道戏法。
  • 蠕行（消耗 2 动作）。 苍白之人移动等于其速度的距离且不触发借机攻击。

Appendix A - Monsters.name: 附录 A：怪物
Appendix A - Monsters.text:
附录 A：怪物

这里描述了一些在德拉肯海姆能发现的新怪物。本附录同样包括了很多基于核心书的怪物，我们会在其中添加额外的特性和新的描述来让它们更符合黑暗奇幻的设定。不过，任何基于 5e 的怪物都可以看作是德拉肯海姆街道上污染的产物，或者是被来自远在幽冥国度的污霭所魔法性地改变。运用以下修改来当做你将其他来源的怪物制作成你最喜欢的德拉肯海姆可憎之物的灵感。

固有特性

任何在德拉肯海姆中遭遇到的非类人生物都具有以下特性。这些特性不会改变怪物的挑战等级。

  • 完全污染。这些生物免疫污染，并且在为对抗污染法术而进行豁免时具有优势。
  • 污霭适性。这些生物即使位于污霭中也仍能从长休中获得收益。它们在污霭和浓厚污霭中能看到两倍远的距离。
  • 污霭依赖。这些生物每在污霭外活动 24 小时都会获得一级力竭。以此获得的力竭不能在该生物位于污霭之外期间被移除。
  • 妄质治疗。以一个动作，一只怪物可以触碰一块妄质晶块来恢复 10（[[/r 3d6]]）点生命值。一旦一只怪物以此法使用了一块妄质晶块，那么该晶块在接下来的 24 小时内无法再以此法使用。

这些好处不适用于起源于污霭之外的生物，也不适用于角色寻获或咒唤来的生物，例如魔宠或者召唤出来的怪物。

扮演特质

所有居住在德拉肯海姆的怪物都难逃异质的疯狂。许多生物因此变得渴望掠夺性且滥用暴力，但仍有少数生物维持着清醒的头脑。然而，即使是这些清醒的生物，它们的精神也并不稳定，时常在疯狂的边缘徘徊。它们不知自己凶恶的嗜好从何而来。所有的怪物都具有以下扮演特质：

  • 个性。我总是容易对周围的类人生物发怒或怀有敌意，残存的理智令我对此感到困惑和沮丧。
  • 理念。我能感觉到一股异样的冲动，渴望着污染或吞噬类人生物。
  • 牵绊。我痴迷于妄质晶体，希望能沐浴在它们那温暖的光芒之下。
  • 缺陷。我有一种或多种类型的永久疯狂，甚至于经常记不起几分钟前的自己在做什么。

一个生物对污霭中其他怪物的反应取决于它自己的本性。它可能是矛盾的、回避的、敌对的，甚至是卑躬屈膝的。

Arcane Wraith

Many spellcasters who died in Drakkenheim have become disembodied and corrupt undead spirits, still flowing with arcane power but twisted into evil, shadowy forms. They drift through the ruins, hungering for magical essence as much as living life force.

  • Add the spellcasting trait below to a @UUID[Actor.maBcitIRTMV3bg5m]. This increases its challenge rating to 6.

Spellcasting. The @UUID[Actor.lAt2j5PaTnH71T5O] is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The wraith knows the following sorcerer spells:

At-will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Utk1OQRwYkMkFRD3], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.41JIhpDyM9Anm7cs], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.oIzA2MEHwxhtQneU]

3/day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.IyikgTEOTv701jgQ]

1/day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.6g3WLOZ2u0EbaLAd]

Crater Wurm

Found only in the Crater Basin, these massive burrowing monsters have petal-like mouths lined with razor-sharp teeth. Their thick hides of midnight purple are covered in spines and octarine slime. Those who have survived an encounter with one have spoken of the earth shaking moments before the beast emerges from below, devouring helpless victims caught in its path.

  • These mutated @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.PtotS52HpHX596cZ] replace their Multiattack and Tail Stinger traits with the following abilities:

Breach. The @UUID[Actor.uXmefMFY5tadWoMU] utilises its full movement. While doing so, it can enter large or smaller creatures' spaces. Whenever the wurm enters a creature's space, the creature must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed to the side of the wurm's space. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature takes 35 (10d6) bludgeoning damage, and is pushed 10 feet and knocked prone. After finishing its move, the wurm can make one bite attack against a prone target as a bonus action.

Contaminated Gullet. A creature swallowed by a crater wurm gains one level of contamination each time it takes acid damage while inside the wurm.

Garmyr

Once thought to be related to gnolls, @UUID[Actor.clmRXQkHQKqlO3R0] are bipedal canids unique to the Haze-ridden ruins of Drakkenheim. Often covered in thick fur, their colouration and features vary from hound-like to wolf-like, but all bear sharp teeth and claws. They form hyper-aggressive and predatory warpacks equipped with weapons taken from the many failed military attempts to reclaim the city. These beasts revel in their countless battles with adventurers and the Hooded Lanterns. The garmyr warpacks have made the Inner City their hunting ground, but have been sighted roving the countryside with increasing frequency. They live for the thrill of the hunt, and mock and taunt their prey as they chase them down. Though the warpacks are prone to infighting, a massive beast known as the @UUID[Actor.CF7PHcpwR43Z2LVS] rules the garmyr as their overlord, master, and god.

A @UUID[Actor.clmRXQkHQKqlO3R0] uses the game statistics for a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.R2GPY9BhRmmwZwkh] with its creature type changed to monstrosity.

Grotesque Gargant

These mutated human monstrosities have grown to tremendous size. Delerium shards are merged into their disfigured bodies, and their muscles pulse with arcane energies as they lumber forward. Furiously territorial, these creatures are occasionally sighted hauling massive delerium crystals from the Crater and placing them like obelisks in the ruins.

This horror uses the game statistics for a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SOin81NWijHRvXFK]. It has the following additional traits, replacing Stone Camouflage, which increase its challenge rating to 8:

Regeneration. A @UUID[Actor.nqdTPETJHquUMVIW] regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn as long as it is within the Deep Haze. The gargant dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

Contaminating Beam. The grotesque gargant magically forces a creature it can see within 60 feet of it to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. The creature takes 27 (6d8) necrotic damage on a failed save and gains one level of Contamination.

Misty Camouflage. The gargant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in any area obscured by mist or fog.

Haze Husk

Those who die in the ruins find no respite. The Haze reanimates their remains to wander the streets as shells forever stuck in the terror of their final moments. Billowing eldritch energies emanate from their eyes, mouth, and wounds and delerium fragments are fused into their flesh.

  • Use the game statistics of a @UUID[Actor.6WlvFzt4aTcnn1Mj]. Replace its Undead Fortitude trait with the following:

Death Burst. If damage reduces the @UUID[Actor.9Ip2Xdb0FDnrWeEh] to 0 hit points, the delerium fragments in its body explode in a burst of contaminated energy, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. Each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. Creatures who fail this saving throw by 5 or more gain one level of contamination.

The Queen's Retinue

Haze Wight

A @UUID[Actor.2z1ZlGCaN2U8uZeP] is more sentient than their haze husk minions, but has still been stripped of their former life. Many were former adventurers, military officers, or mighty warriors who died in the Haze. Many still believe themselves to be great heroes rallying the common folk of Drakkenheim against invaders, but in their madness they see all humanoids as monsters.

These @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.rbyp54px2D0ql4QK]{Wights} have the following actions in place of their Life Drain action:

Contaminated Touch. Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of contamination.

Create Haze Husk. The wight targets a humanoid within 10 feet of it that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently. It rises as a haze husk in an unoccupied space within 5 feet. The haze husk is under the wight's control. The wight can have no more than 12 haze husks under its control at one time.

Tower Dragon

These @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.NmQLj0zv4FmfuSan]{Young Bronze Dragons} perch upon the towers and parapets of the city and Castle Drakken. Once noble protectors of the city, they are now controlled by the will of the Haze. They have the following additional traits, which give the dragon a challenge rating of 10:

  • Senses truesight 120 ft.
  • Damage Resistances poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine
  • Condition Immunities charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
  • Constructed Nature. The dragon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.
  • False Appearance. While the dragon remains motionless,it is indistinguishable from an inanimate bronze statue.
  • Faultless Tracker. The creature(s) that caused the dragon to animate becomes its quarry. The dragon knows the direction and distance to its quarry as long the quarry remains within Drakkenheim or until the dragon is destroyed.
  • Immutable Form. The dragon is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.
  • Magic Resistance. The dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
  • Magic Weapons. The dragon's weapon attacks are magical.
  • Rejuvenation. If the @UUID[Actor.NxVKmMdsfKoJEAJP] is destroyed, it regains all its hit points in 1 hour unless a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.HBHbOGKNVVprSlwn] spell is cast on its remains.

Wall Gargoyle

These @UUID[Actor.pIco9QnC61hFiUtp]{Gargoyles} defend the walls of Drakkenheim and have the following additional traits:

  • Senses truesight 120 ft.
  • Faultless Tracker. The creature that caused the gargoyle to animate becomes its quarry. The gargoyle knows the direction and distance to its quarry as long the quarry remains within Drakkenheim or until the gargoyle is destroyed.
  • Keen Sight. The gargoyle has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
  • Magic Weapons. The gargoyle's weapon attacks are magical.
  • Rejuvenation. If the @UUID[Actor.nPZV2GKXoktLDu31] is destroyed, it regains all its hit points in 1 hour unless a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.HBHbOGKNVVprSlwn] spell is cast on its remains.

Warp Witch

These ethereal phantoms haunt the places where they died, grasping for any memory of their former identities. Their mental anguish breaks the minds of those who hear their wails, and they induce rapid mutations when they possess humanoid bodies.

  • These @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.qoFEjfrANBdrCP6m]{Ghosts} replace their Horrifying Visage action with the following actions:

Psychic Wail (Recharge 5-6). Every creature within 30 feet of the @UUID[Actor.OH6Ong42U0roAZ6F] must succeed on a DC 13 Intelligence saving throw or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage and become incapacitated until the end of the warp witches next turn.

Mutate Host. The warp witch can use a bonus action while it is possessing a creature to force mutations upon its host. The possessed creature must succeed on a DC 13 Charisma saving throw or gain one level of contamination. Rather than rolling to determine if a mutation occurs, the warp witch automatically causes a random mutation.

Delerium Dreg.name: 妄质生骸
Delerium Dreg.text:
“Who knows how many of these twisted abominations were once our steadfast comrades, friends, and loved ones. When you see these lost souls, you must not hesitate.”

- Elias Drexel

Many who succumb to contamination become grotesque mockeries of their former selves. They suffer a wretched and loathsome fate, aimlessly wandering the ruins following half-forgotten memories. Most are gripped by despair, fear, and madness which drive them to act violently, though a rare few experience lucidity and a gruesome awareness of their miserable state. Their distorted and emaciated bodies are sustained by the magic of the Haze.

Delerium Dreg

Medium aberration, unaligned

  • Armour Class 11
  • Hit Points 22 (5d8)
  • Speed 30 ft.
  • STR15 (+2)
  • DEX13 (+1)
  • CON11 (+0)
  • INT7 (-2)
  • WIS10 (+0)
  • CHA5 (-3)
  • Senses darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 10
  • Languages Common
  • Challenge 1/2 (100 XP)

Misty Camouflage. A delerium dreg has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in any area obscured by mist or fog.

Actions

Spear. Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

Delerium Dreg Knight

Variant: Dreg Mutations

A delerium dreg might have one of the following additional sets of traits: These do not change the dreg's Challenge Rating.

@UUID[Actor.987Wm71wEZ5XyT1i]{Aquatic} (Deep One or “Fishfolk”)

These mutated creatures have piscine faces, gills, fins, and fish scales. They are garbed in wet rags and carry spears and shields, and dwell deep within the sewers and underground caverns below the city.

Amphibious. An aquatic dreg can breathe air and water. It has a swimming speed of 30 feet.

Blindsight. An aquatic dreg gains blindsight with a radiusof 30 feet.

@UUID[Actor.ijXBTbXbJtdjEy12]{Bloated}

Death Burst. When a bloated delerium dreg dies, it explodes in a burst of corrupt offal. Each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures who fail their saving throw by 5 or more gain one level of contamination.

Bile Spray (Recharge 5-6). The bloated delerium dreg exhales a 15-foot cone of acid. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures who fail their saving throw by 5 or more gain one level of contamination.

@UUID[Actor.9lWcIwv1zn9zgSm7]{Chitinous}

Armoured Shell. A chitinous dreg has AC 18.

@UUID[Actor.nEncZ63Ov2bscmvF]{Cyclopean}

Spectral Vision. A cyclopean dreg gains truesight 60 feet. It has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

Mad Certainty. A cyclopean dreg is immune to the frightened condition and psychic damage.

Psychic Shriek (Recharge 6). Creatures within 20 feet of the cyclopean dreg must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or take 7 (2d6) psychic damage and be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

@UUID[Actor.yzHQQVlebeVtAamo]{Displaced}

Displacement. Attack rolls against a displaced dreg have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displaced dreg is incapacitated or has a speed of 0.

Teleport (Recharge 4–6). The displaced dreg magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Before or after teleporting, the dreg can make one melee attack. If this attack hits, it deals an extra 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

@UUID[Actor.QD0iOIavBTKQFeCH]{Frenzied}

Reckless. At the start of its turn, a frenzied dreg can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

Brute. A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the frenzied dreg hits with it.

@UUID[Actor.ufCDDhqiLdIjF9Nb]{Lambent}

Illumination. A lambent delerium dreg sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet.

Octarine Beam. The lambent dreg targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures who fail their saving throw by 5 or more gain one level of contamination.

@UUID[Actor.3OCzbD5wkbzCu5mH]{Leeching}

Bounding Leap. The leeching dreg's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

Blood Drain. Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the dreg attaches to the target. While attached, the dreg can't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the dreg's turns, the target takes 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

The attached dreg moves with the target whenever the target moves, requiring none of the dreg's movement. The dreg can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement on its turn. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the dreg.

@UUID[Actor.luNfjHXbsig4bMAO]{Lurking}

Normal Semblance. The lurking dreg has advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks to pass itself off as a normal humanoid creature.

Sneak Attack (1/Turn). The dreg deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the dreg that isn't incapacitated and the dreg doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

@UUID[Actor.vNIWA5jMoT0dlIzZ]{Spined}

Spider Climb. The spined dreg has a climb speed equal to its walking speed. It can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Multiattack. The dreg makes three spike attacks.

Spike. Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 +1) piercing damage.

@UUID[Actor.jWhywrjRVft3DkSx]{Tentacled}

Amorphous. The dreg can move through a space as narrow as 6 inches wide without squeezing.

Tentacles. Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tentacled dreg can't use its tentacles on another target.

神圣干预（1/周）。 卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯呼唤神圣之火的支援。回应的结果由 GM 作出选择；此时通常请求任何牧师法术或者领域法术的效应都在可接受范围内。

+3 刺剑。 近战武器攻击：+13 命中， 触及 5 尺，单一目标 命中： 13 （1d8 + 8） 穿刺伤害。

Urban Ranger.name: 城市游侠
Urban Ranger.text:
城市游侠

“日复一日地训练是为了在这危险城市中活下去，因为你我所背负的不仅仅是自己的生命，而只需要一次失手的攻击、一次在道路间迷失、一瞬间的疏于观察，都足以让你在危险的废墟中丧命。”

——覆影明灯的佩特拉·朗

阴森冷峻的@UUID[Actor.02VvEfOHseDs38Jm]{城市游侠}在暗巷与屋顶间蛰伏，如同其它游侠在林间小路与枝干树梢间穿行一般。它们擅长在建筑物间跃行，攀爬墙壁更是轻而易举。

城市游侠

中型类人生物，任意阵营

  • 护甲等级 15（镶钉皮甲）
  • 生命值 52 （8d8 + 16）
  • 速度 30 尺，攀爬 30 尺
  • 力量12 （+1）
  • 敏捷17 （+3）
  • 体质14 （+2）
  • 智力11 （+0）
  • 感知15 （+2）
  • 魅力11 （+0）
  • 技能 运动 +5，察觉 +6，隐匿 +7，求生 +6
  • 感官 被动察觉 16
  • 语言 任意两种
  • 挑战等级 3 （700 XP）

  • 施法。 城市游侠是一位 8 级施法者，使用感知作为施法属性（法术豁免 DC12，法术攻击命中 +4）。它已知以下游侠法术：

    1 环（4 法术位）：@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.uUWb1wZgtMou0TVP]{疗伤术}，@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.IBJmWjzbQGu7M4UX]{云雾术}，@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.0xmXiPiuYws1OGcX]{猎人印记}

    2 环（3 法术位）：@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pRMvmknwLf2tdMTj]{行动无踪}，@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.9gYGkrL6qFTsE6fw]{荆棘丛生}

Appendix C - Contamination.name: 附录 C：污染
Appendix C - Contamination.text:
附录 C：污染

探索德拉肯海姆的角色可能会遭受污霭中的可怖污染物或妄质发出的奥术辐射中。这些危害物会造成一种新状态，称为污染，这种状态会造成衰弱症状和超自然的突变。

污染分为六个级别。有的效应会给生物施加污染等级，其施加的污染等级数量会在其描述中提及。如果一个已经受污染的生物受到另一种效应影响导致污染等级提高，其当前的污染等级会增加效应描述中指定的数量。

此外，每当角色在有至少一级污染的情况下完成长休时，掷 1d20。掷出 1 时，它们将获得一级污染。

当达到 6 级以上的污染时，生物会按照“怪物转变！”部分中的描述进行变形。

污染症状

受污染的生物要承受当前等级和更低等级的症状。

等级症状
1无事发生。
2消耗生命骰恢复的生命值减半。
3完成长休不恢复生命值。
4通过武器攻击和法术造成的伤害减半。
5失能
6怪诞转变！

突变

除了承受上述症状外，每次角色获得污染等级时，都要掷 1d6。如果结果等于或小于角色当前的污染等级，则生物获得一种突变。GM 可以自行选择突变类型，也可以掷突变表的 1d20 随机决定。如果结果与当前影响生物的突变相同，GM 选择不同的突变或再次掷骰。

移除污染

只有特定的魔法可以移除污染等级，生物不会自然痊愈。法术@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.PurT000000000008]{祛除污染}可以移除污染，但是它有让角色力竭的效果。法术@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.qcYitWoSMTnKkzM1]{医疗术}可以为一个受污染的角色移除所有的污染等级和突变。

移除污染等级的效应也会同时移除一个随机的突变。一个生物的污染等级降至小于 1 时，其所有的污染症状都会结束，突变也都会被移除。因突变脱落的皮肤，毛发，指甲和脚趾甲会在污染被移除时正常再生。不过其他因污染等级而失去的身体部件（例如牙齿，四肢或眼睛）需要用法术@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.9kGrFXnLiRg3Xnbo]{再生术}或者类似的魔法才能恢复。由于突变而形成的附体或肢体在污染被移除后会枯萎并脱落，其他被扭曲的身体部位也会恢复原状。

受污染的死亡和临终

具有任何的污染等级的类人生物会在死亡 24 小时后会变成一只@UUID[Actor.9Ip2Xdb0FDnrWeEh]{污霭行尸}。具有 6 个及以上职业等级或者生命骰的生物会变成@UUID[Actor.2z1ZlGCaN2U8uZeP]{污霭尸妖}。

死后复活的生物污染等级会降低一级。

怪诞转变！

达到六级及以上污染的生物会开始转变为由 GM 控制的可怕怪物。一旦产生这种转变，变化将在一轮内完成。此后它将永久持续。GM 可以进行适当血腥的转变描述。

GM 选择这个生物的新形态。通常是某种异怪或怪兽，例如@UUID[Actor.WRMeQqdgYSpAR9zx]{妄质生骸}，@UUID[Actor.sHgFXfdwxl0mefuB]{污霭巨怪}，或是@UUID[Actor.gwrdsxHSdMxcmK79]{惧噬体}（见附录 A）。新形态的挑战等级通常与原本的生物的挑战等级相似，但在适当的情况下，你也可以选择更高或更低的挑战等级。

该生物的游戏数据完全被所选怪物的游戏数据替代。该生物获得新形态的生命值和生命骰。污染等级全都会被移除，不过 GM 可以给新形态加上额外的特性，这些特性和原本从污染等级中获得的任何有益突变相似。

GM 决定原本生物的个性和记忆剩下的部分（如果有的话）。无论如何，这个生物一定会被这种转变逼疯，并落入 GM 的控制之下。

逆转变

在这场战役的开头，逆转怪诞转变的方法是完全未知的。怪诞转变被广泛认为是永久的，不过还是有很多人在废墟中寻找答案。那些这么做的人可能最终能够研究出法术@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.SipT000000000011]{污染转嫁}（见 附录 D）。

法术@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz]{祈愿术}或类似的魔法可以把一个被转变的生物恢复回原本的形态，在这个过程中消除所有疯狂和污染。这种用法视作@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz]{祈愿术}的负担用法，因此如果施法者以这种方式施展，它将有 33%的概率无法再施展@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz]{祈愿术}。

除此之外，如果没有神力干预，这种转变无论如何都是不可逆转的。然而，根据 GM 的判断，可能有办法可以暂时缓解被转变生物自发的疯狂。然而，一个接受任何形式长期治疗的智能怪物最终都可能密谋污染或巧妙地腐化其治疗者。

Appendix D - Delerium, Magic and Spells.name: 附录 D：魔法和法术
Appendix D - Delerium, Magic and Spells.text:
Appendix D: Delerium,
Magic & Spells

Delerium

Delerium is a magical mineral left behind by the meteor. It appears in geode clusters of translucent, sharp-edged crystals which reflect octarine light. The eldritch stones softly hum in dissonant tones, and glow brightly at night or when exposed to magic. Deposits are found throughout Drakkenheim, often fused into stone streets and buildings like crystalline moss.

A typical delerium fragment is about the size of a finger. Crystals may be fist-sized or slightly larger, and geodes may be as big as a pumpkin. Massive clusters might grow taller than a human.

“The real meat and potatoes of our city's problem...delerium may be worth its weight in tuna, but is it worth all the trouble that follows?”

— Veo Sjena
Size Market Value Weight AC HP Extraction
Chip 10 gold 1/4 lbs 15 5 1 action
Fragment 100 gold 1/2 lbs 17 10 1 minute
Shard 500 gold 1 lbs 19 15 5 minutes
Crystal 1,000 gold 2 lbs 21 20 30 minutes
Geode 5,000 gold 20 lbs+ 23 25 1 hour
Massive Cluster Priceless 8000 lbs+ 25 50 7 days

Delerium Properties

All delerium samples have the following traits regardless of size:

  • Immune to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage; as well as bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.
  • Resistant to acid, cold, fire, and lightning damage; as well as slashing and piercing damage from magical weapons.
  • Vulnerable to bludgeoning damage from magical weapons.
  • Unless contained within an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Eon0jzGzQRNluTPQ], delerium shatters and crumbles into worthless ash when reduced to zero hit points. However, delerium geodes release a random @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.tables.RollTable.pPGtKhPFFcHortCT]{Arcane Anomaly} when destroyed (see below).

Delerium Hazards

When a humanoid creature touches delerium without protective gear (such as gloves or tongs) for the first time on their turn, or ends their turn in bodily contact with delerium, they must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take [[/damage 1d6 necrotic]] damage and gain one level of contamination (see Appendix C).

Delerium Harvesting

Delerium found in Drakkenheim is usually fused into the ground or stone buildings, and may be carefully extracted using handheld mining equipment such as shovels, picks, hammers, and chisels. Consult the table to determine how long it takes characters to harvest a shard. Lacking proper equipment, extraction takes ten times as long. Massive clusters are impossible to extract without heavy equipment or powerful magic.

Uses for Delerium

Delerium has vast arcane potential. Beyond trade, crystals are used for several purposes:

Spell Component. Delerium may be used as an arcane focus or material component for any spell on the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list. When casting a spell which requires a costly material component, a spellcaster may instead use delerium of equivalent value to the required cost.

Magic Items. Delerium is an exceptional material for creating magical items of all kinds. Several new magic items are described herein, but any existing magic item described in the Core Rules could be made with delerium. Fragments, shards, crystals, and geodes may be used to make uncommon, rare, very rare, and legendary items respectively. At the GM's discretion, characters who can cast 5th level spells or higher may learn techniques to craft magic items of their own during their downtime.

Stable Delerium. The process for crafting magic items with delerium renders the crystals stable. Unless otherwise specified, characters do not take damage nor risk contamination when they touch or handle stable delerium. Stable delerium is damaged and destroyed in the same manner as a normal magic item of its kind.

Delerium Dust. Delerium dust is made by grinding the crystals against one another to create a fine powder. This milling process is extraordinarily hazardous unless performed within an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Eon0jzGzQRNluTPQ]. Delerium dust can be used in alchemy, as a spell component, a reagent for brewing potions, or mixed into inks for spell scrolls.

Improvised Weapons & Ammunition. Delerium fragments may be used as ammunition for a sling or fashioned into a makeshift club. Such weapons and ammunition deal an extra [[/damage 1d6 necrotic]] damage, and non-contaminated creatures struck must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of contamination. Delerium used as ammunition in this way is destroyed.

“The essence of delerium is intoxicating, like looking upon raw power. I swear you can feel it draw you in. A lesser man might be drawn to the contamination, embracing it fully as a gift.”

— Sebastian Crowe

 

“It's heavy and dangerous like some of the best men I know, including me.”

— Pluto Jackson

Spells.name: 法术
Spells.text:
Spells

This section contains new spells found in the Drakkenheim campaign. While many monsters and NPCs know these spells, they are not available to player characters at the outset of the campaign. Instead, characters must either study the spell from a found spellbook or scroll, locate a mentor to teach them the spell, or research the spells themselves!

Learning the Spells

Once they've found a spellbook or teacher, a character must spend downtime and gold to master the spell before they may cast it. For each level of the spell, the character must spend two days of downtime and 100 gp practicing the spell. Once complete, the character may prepare the spell, add it to their spellbook, or replace a spell they already know with the new spell, as appropriate for the spellcasting features of their class.

Researching New Spells

@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.ConT000000000001], @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.ConT000000000002], @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.NeuT000000000006], and @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.SipT000000000011] are totally undiscovered at the outset of the campaign, and must be researched by the player characters themselves. The spell descriptions outline the prerequisites needed to successfully research the spell. Once these requirements are met, a character must spend downtime and gold to complete the research: for each level of the spell, the character must spend 5 days of downtime and 250 gp. Once complete, the character may prepare the spell, add it to their spellbook, or replace a spell they already know with the new spell, as appropriate for the spellcasting features of their class.

Secret Spells

In the world of Drakkenheim, several powerful spells found in the Core Rules are significantly rarer than normal: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.TIoadMIsUKD4edXi], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XbwGq5kDJNvAxNXV], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.J6Jpw5XzB5aTeqnz], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.jccbeBIfLrqEZnDP], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.qLeEXZDbW5y4bmLY], and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz]. At the Game Master's option, player characters must obtain knowledge of these spells in the same manner as other spells presented in this book.

Non-player characters do not have access to these spells unless specifically indicated in their description or game statistics. Furthermore, the material components for these spells are exceptionally scarce and should be treated as consumable magic items of very rare (for 7th and 8th level spells) or legendary rarity (for 9th level spells).

Contaminated Spells

Several spells include the “contaminated” descriptor beside their school of magic. Such spells always require delerium as a material component, and cause the caster to gain contamination when cast, as described in the spell description of each spell. The spellcaster can't prevent or ignore gaining this contamination level by any means, otherwise a contaminated spell simply fails.

Seals of Drakkenheim.name: 德拉肯海姆信物
Seals of Drakkenheim.text:
The Seals of Drakkenheim were jointly crafted by mages of the Amethyst Academy and the clergy of the Sacred Flame, and gifted to the royal family of Drakkenheim after the Edicts of Lumen. The six members of the royal council traditionally each carried one of these potent symbols of political authority, while the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.CroT000000000022] was worn by the monarch. While each faction seeks at least one of these magic items, the Hooded Lanterns and the @UUID[Actor.k1Me7WfCcgKcAFQe] wish to collect all of them so they can determine the political destiny of Drakkenheim.

Crown Authority

A character cannot attune to more than one Seal of Drakkenheim. Guardian constructs in Drakkenheim such as @UUID[Actor.nPZV2GKXoktLDu31]{Wall Gargoyles} and @UUID[Actor.NxVKmMdsfKoJEAJP]{Tower Dragons} do not attack you while you are attuned to one of the Seals of Drakkenheim. An individual guardian ignores this effect for 24 hours if you attack it or cast a spell upon it.

As an action, you may present a Seal of Drakkenheim to rebuke the guardians. You make an opposed Charisma ability check against each @UUID[Actor.nPZV2GKXoktLDu31]{Wall Gargoyles} or @UUID[Actor.NxVKmMdsfKoJEAJP] that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you. If you win the contest, the creature is rebuked for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. A rebuked creature doesn't move, and can't take actions or reactions. A creature who wins the contest is immune to your rebuke for 24 hours.

These holy relics of the Sacred Flame were wielded by Saint Vitruvio and are kept in several religious sites throughout Drakkenheim.
